text: ANOVA â€¢ You do not need to know most calculations for ANOVA â€¢ Weâ€™ll focus on conceptual logic of ANOVA: â€“ Why is it called â€œANalysis Of VArianceâ€? â€“ What are MSbetween, MSwithin, & F-ratio â€“ What is the shape of the F-distribution? â€“ What are df for ANOVA? â€“ What conclusion follows from the ANOVA test? â€¢ What follow-up tests are generally performed? 1 ANOVA â€¢ We use ANOVA when comparing more than 2 groups â€“ But, ANOVA can also be used for exactly two groups â€¢ Decision will be the same, in fact F = t2 â€¢ â€œOne-wayâ€ ANOVA has one IV â€“ Ex. Testing anti-anxiety Rx with 500mg, 1000mg, or placebo control â€¢ One IV with three levels 2 ANOVA: Factorial â€¢ â€œFactorialâ€ ANOVA has multiple IVs (Ch. 16) â€“ Factor 1: Dose (500mg, 1000mg, placebo) â€“ Factor 2: Schedule (once per day, twice per day) â€¢ â€œFullyâ€ factorial = all combinations 3 500mg 1000mg Placebo Once 500mg/once 1000mg/once Placebo/once Twice 250mg/twice 500mg/twice Placebo/twice DoseSchedule ANOVA: Assumptions 1. Sampled populations are normally distributed* 2. DV is interval or ratio* 3.
